009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
013
014/**
015 * Basically a 2D array of pixels which
016 * holds all necessary information about the image geometry,
017 * keeps track of which pixels have been visited and knows how
018 * to access neighboring pixels (currently 4-neighborhood only).
019 * TODO: Bring in line with binary region neighborhoods (type).
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2022/11/19
023 */
024public class PixelMap {
025        
026        /** Image width */
027        public final int width;
028        
029        /** Image height */
030        public final int height;
031        
032        private final Pixel[][] pixels;
033        
034        /**
035         * Constructor.
036         * @param ip source image
037         */
038        public PixelMap(ImageProcessor ip) {
039                this.width = ip.getWidth();
040                this.height = ip.getHeight();
041                this.pixels = makeImagePoints(ip);
042        }
043        
044        private Pixel[][] makeImagePoints(ImageProcessor ip) {
045                Pixel[][] ipts = new Pixel[width][height];
046                for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
047                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
048                                ipts[u][v] = new Pixel(u, v, ip.get(u, v));
049                        }
050                }
051                return ipts;
052        }
053
054        /**
055         * Returns the {@link Pixel} instance at the specified position.
056         * @param u horizontal position
057         * @param v vertical position
058         * @return the {@link Pixel} instance
059         */
060        public Pixel getPixel(int u, int v) {
061                return pixels[u][v];
062        }
063        
064        /**
065         * Returns a new 1D array (i.e., a "flattened" vector in row-first order) of {@link Pixel} elements,
066         * e.g., for sorting pixels by value.
067         * 
068         * @return a 1D array of pixels
069         */
070        public Pixel[] getPixelVector() {
071                final Pixel[] pix = new Pixel[width * height];
072                int i = 0;
073                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
074                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
075                                pix[i] = pixels[u][v];
076                                i++;
077                        }
078                }
079                return pix;
080        }
081        
082        /**
083         * Sets all pixels to unvisited and resets next-neighbor search directions.
084         */
085        void reset() {
086                //this.visited.unsetAll();
087                for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
088                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
089                                pixels[u][v].reset();
090                        }
091                }
092        }
093        
094        // ------------------------------------
095        
096        
097//      public PointNeighborhood getNeighbors(PntInt p) {
098//              return new PointNeighborhood(p);
099//      }
100//      
101//      public class PointNeighborhood implements Iterable<ImagePoint> {
102//              private final int x, y; // the center of this neighborhood
103//              private int xn, yn;     // the coordinates of the next neighbor
104//              private int dir=  -1;   // the direction of the next neighbor (valid if dir=0,..,3)
105//              
106//              protected PointNeighborhood(PntInt p) {
107//                      this.x = p.x;
108//                      this.y = p.y;
109//                      findNextNeighbor();
110//              }
111//              
112//              private void findNextNeighbor() {
113//                      dir = dir + 1;
114//                      while (dir < 4) {
115//                              xn = x + dX[dir];
116//                              yn = y + dY[dir];
117//                              if (xn >= 0 && xn < width && yn >= 0 && yn < height) {
118//                                      break;  // found neighbor, don't advance dir
119//                              }
120//                              dir = dir + 1;
121//                      }
122//              }
123//
124//              @Override
125//              public Iterator<ImagePoint> iterator() {
126//                      return new Iterator<ImagePoint>() {
127//                              @Override
128//                              public boolean hasNext() {
129//                                      return dir < 4;
130//                              }
131//                              @Override
132//                              public ImagePoint next() {
133//                                      ImagePoint nextPnt = imagePoints[xn][yn];
134//                                      findNextNeighbor();
135//                                      return nextPnt;
136//                              }
137//                      };
138//              }
139//              
140//      }
141        
142        // --------------------------------------------------------
143        
144        private static final int[] dX = {1, 0, -1, 0};
145        private static final int[] dY = {0, -1, 0, 1};
146        
147        /**
148         * A pixel value which knows its coordinates.
149         * This is a non-static class, i.e.,  {@link Pixel} instances can only
150         * exist in the context of a {@link PixelMap} instance.
151         */
152        public class Pixel extends PntInt implements Comparable<Pixel> {
153                
154                public final int val;           // the pixel value
155                private byte dir = 0;           // next-neighbor search direction
156
157                // only the enclosing PixelMap can instantiate pixels
158                public Pixel(int x, int y, int val) {
159                        super(x, y);    // Pnt2d.PntInt
160                        this.val = val;
161                }
162                
163                /**
164                 * Sets this pixel to unvisited and resets its next-neighbor search direction.
165                 */
166                public void reset() {
167                        this.dir = 0;
168                }
169                
170                /**
171                 * Gets the next neighbor of this pixel that is inside
172                 * the containing image.
173                 * @return the next neighboring {@link Pixel} or {@code null} if no more neighbors
174                 */
175                public Pixel getNextNeighbor() {
176                        int u = -1, v = -1;
177                        boolean found = false;
178                        while (this.dir < 4 && !found) {
179                                // try direction dir
180                                u = this.x + dX[this.dir];      // coordinates of neighbor in direction n
181                                v = this.y + dY[this.dir];
182                                found = (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height);
183                                this.dir++;
184                        }
185                        if (found) {
186                                return PixelMap.this.getPixel(u, v);
187                        }
188                        return null;
189                }
190
191                @Override       // sorts by increasing val
192                public int compareTo(Pixel other) {
193                        //return val - other.val;
194                        return Integer.compare(this.val, other.val);
195                }
196
197                @Override
198                public String toString() {
199                        return String.format("%s[x=%d, y=%d, val=%d]", Pixel.class.getSimpleName(), x, y, val);
200                }
201
202        }
203}
